instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3332 randomly freezing
threads.message: This 820-3332-A works fine until it randomly freezes. If it freezes it still shows a picture but i cant type anything nor move the mouse. Same if i boot from an external drive. Power Button can still turn it off. I already resoldered the joints on U8900 but no change. Can a reflow or new IC help i this case? Or is it a different problem this time? I remeber from one of Louis´s streams that there also is an issue where the CPU clocks down so far that the device crashes... Could it be that?

threads.title: 820-3332 randomly freezing
threads.message: I let it sit running for a while now to test it and as i came back to it it wont show a picture anymore. Not it spins the fans like crazy but did not show any picture anymore. Even if i unplug the battery and wait it wont show anything on the screen. It also wont chime and PRAM reset is also not possible anymore. And i did not touch it...GPU_VCORE is 0.9V.

threads.title: 820-3332 randomly freezing
threads.message: Is one of the fan screw holes stripped? If so is it the one on the backside of the VRAM? Just a guess but check your soldering on U8900 as well

threads.title: 820-3332 randomly freezing
threads.message: Screw holes look fine. Also there are only original screws (the 6 bigger and the two flat ones) screwed onto the heatsink. Can my soldering be bad if VCORE is 0.9V?

threads.title: 820-3332 randomly freezing
threads.message: Freezing like that will not be U8900. This can be anything and I this will be a time waster board. Probably cracked trace/ball under CPU/RAM or something that vague. Hopeless.
